images.title: Barry Hurst / Cheese Gate Nab
images.caption: Cheese Gate Nab, just to the east of the village. Taken from the fields south of Mill Shaw Lane on the Barnsley Boundary Walk. Upper Millshaw Hall Farm, beyond the horses, nestles under Cheese Gate Nab, a gentle Pennine escarpment which rises to 385m (1263ft).

images.title: Steve F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ingbirchworth reservoir

description: Hepworth is located just east of Holmfirth in the Holme Valley area of West Yorkshire. There's lots of great options for walkers with several waymarked trails, hill climbs and a series of local reservoirs to visit. Viewers of long running tv show Last of the Summer Wine may recognise the village as the 'Butchers Arms' pub was regularly used as a setting in the show. This walk from the village uses a section of the Barnsley Boundary Walk to visit a series of local reservoirs. On the walk you'll visit Broadstone Reservoir before heading to the Scout Dike, Royd Moor and Ingbirchworth Reservoirs near Penistone. The walk starts in the village and heads east where you can pick up the Barnsley Boundary Walk. Follow the waymarked footpath east and it will take you past Broadstone Reservoir to the neighbourging village of Ingbirchworth and its reservoir. Just to the south of here you will also find Scout Dike and Royd Moor Reservoir. Here you can pick up the Penistone Boundary Walk, a circular trail exploring the area around the town, with some nice views of the River Don .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head to the Butcher's Arms for some rest and refreshment after your exercise. The pub dates back to the early 1800s and includes a traditional bar with stone floors and an open fire. They serve good quality food and have a fine selection of ales. You can find them at postcode HD9 1TE for your sat navs.

display_address: Foster Place Lane, Holme Valley, Hepworth, Kirklees, West Yorkshire, England, HD9 1TJ, United Kingdom
